title: Camber Caster Gauge from Fasttrax at Eastwood

the fast track stage has a unique wheel
mounting mechanism first loosen the

black planting knob and rotate the
adjusting enough

this lets the fast track stage work on
wheels from 13 to 18 inches in diameter

fast-tracks bubble gauge is equipped
with a locking pin to set the bubble

gauge to zero camber for flat level
surface this gauge can be calibrated for

use on non level surfaces by unscrewing
the locking pin and using the floor

cited pivot knob to lock the bio block
into place

position the fast track stage dicks to
the tire on the ground facing the

operator pull the cage flush on the
ground and adjust the vile block 20
degrees camera

tighten the four-sided pivot on this
will level the fast track stage the
floor

make sure to repeat this procedure when
using the gauge on the other side of the

vehicle now model too fast track's gauge
on the wheel

this can be done on you the inner or
outer lip depending on wheel
configuration

no lip wheel adapters for the fast track
stage are available separately

make sure the three mounting points are
flush against the wheel

now adjust the tool to apply enough
pressure for a snug fit and tighten the

black clamping knob positive or negative
camber for this wheel can now be written

directly on the camera scale of the
bubble gauge to measure caster first

turn the wheel out 15 degrees using the
angled tip of the vile block as a guide

use turn plates if available loosen the
pivot knob and set the gauge 20 using
the caster scale
straighten the pivot

now turn the wheel 15 degrees inward
again use the angled tip of the gauge or
use term place
yeah
yeah

pastor for this wheel and now be read
directly off the caster scale

to measure toe with the fast track's
gauge the optional 91 102 adapter kit is

needed with the tow kit installed on the
fast track stage in the wheel straight
ahead

loosen the lock knobs and lower the arms
of the toe adapter

insert the head of a standard measuring
tip into one of the toe adapter slots

preferably even with the outside of the
tire measure to a reference point on the

other side using the tire itself or flat
bar record the measurement

now repeat the measurement for the
opposite side of the tire and record

that measurement the difference between
the two measurements is total toe
yeah

using a second 91,000 fast-tracks gauge
along with that o adapter is another way

of quickly measuring caster camber and
toe on both sides of the vehicle

make sure to calibrate the unit as was
done on the other side of the vehicle

you have term plates are not being used
to make sure to settle the suspension
before we measuring toe

I swing up the toe adapter arms and
rolling vehicle back and forth with this

gauge a quick check can be done on
vehicles to determine if alignment ankle
adjustments are needed

we will now illustrate how quick and
easy the fast track skates can be used

to measure alignment angles at almost
any location
